title: Marc Andreessen and the Browser
description: A fast breakdown of Marc Andreessen and the Browser for builders.

hook.text: The web existed for years but almost nobody used it â€” until a college student made it visual.

buildup.text: Marc Andreessen co-created Mosaic in 1993, the first browser to display images alongside text.

discovery.text: Mosaic made the web accessible to non-technical people. Point, click, and the world was at your fingertips.

twist.text: Andreessen left academia, co-founded Netscape, and kicked off the dot-com boom and the browser wars.

climax.text: The graphical browser turned the web from a research tool into a mass medium used by billions.

punchline.text: Adding pictures to the web changed everything.

quiz.question: What made Mosaic revolutionary?
options: It was the first text-based browser
